You have support, a family, and everything you need to be successful.”—Jalen McFerren (Business Administration, ’18)StudentsRecords & FormsStudent Records & Registration FormsTranscript RequestGraduation InformationAcademic AdvisingCommencement InformationGraduation Planning SourceFile for GraduationSupport ServicesAccessibility Resource Center (ARC)Health & Safety LinksOffice of Diversity & InclusionStudent Conduct, Rights and ResponsibilitiesTitle IX CoordinatorVeterans AffairsFaculty & StaffAdministration & LeadershipOffice of the PresidentUniversity LeadershipCommitteesAcademic Senate & other committeesStaff CouncilEmployee ResourcesHuman ResourcesBenefits & Workers' CompensationAcademic PersonnelStaff Development & Online TrainingEmployee Assistance ProgramUniversity Ombuds OfficeCollective BargainingFaculty and TA, GA & ISA Labor RelationsCalifornia Faculty AssociationCSU Collective Bargaining Agreements (CBA)Labor Relations & Staff UnionsTeaching ResourcesFaculty DevelopmentTechnology & Learning Program (TLP)Accessibility Resource Center (ARC)Technology and DataIT Support ServicesData at Chico StateParentsParent PortalTuition/Fee PaymentsMore Parent ResourcesAlumniChico State Alumni AssociationAlumni Career ServicesWildcat Connect Mentorship NetworkWe acknowledge and are mindful that Chico State stands on lands that were originally occupied by the first people of this area, the Mechoopda, and we recognize their distinctive spiritual relationship with this land, the flora, the fauna, and the waters that run through campus.We are humbled that our campus resides upon sacred lands that since time immemorial have sustained the Mechoopda people and continue to do so today.MenuChico State HomeAboutAcademicsAdmissionsCost & AidStudent LifeAcademic DepartmentsAthleticsAlumniParentsChico FactsGiveResourcesQuicklinksCampus CalendarCampus SafetyJob OpportunitiesAccessibility Resource CenterAnnual Security Report (PDF)
We acknowledge and are mindful that Chico State stands on lands that were originally occupied by the first people of this area, Mechoopda, and we recognize their distinctive spiritual relationship with this land, the flora, the fauna, and the waters that run through campus. We are humbled that our campus resides upon sacred lands that since time immemorial have sustained the Mechoopda people and continue to do so today.Contact UsNeed Help?FacebookFacebookTwitterTwitterInstagramInstagramReport an accessibility issueReport a broken link on this pageTitle IXPrivacy PolicyCalifornia State University, Chico400 West First StreetChico, CA 95929Copyright © 2023 All Rights Reserved
